intro: Chorizanthe novoana, commonly known as the New Zealand thornweed, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, windy conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss. Chorizanthe novoana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for native insects and birds.
